Package game.actions

Class FireShotgunAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action
      • game.actions.FireShotgunAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionInterface
    public class FireShotgunAction
extends Action
    Special Action that allows Actor to fire shotgun towards the direction chosen.
    Author:
    Siang Jo Yee

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FireShotgunAction​(java.lang.String direction, java.lang.String hotKey, int damagePoints)
      Create a FireShotgunAction object using a String that specifies the direction where the shotgun is fired towards, a String that specifies the key used in the menu and an integer that specifies the damage points of the target.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Allow the shotgun to hurt the target within its area of effect based on the direction chosen by the Player and return description of the firing action of the shotgun.
      java.lang.String hotkey()
      Returns the key used in the menu to trigger this Action.
      java.lang.String menuDescription​(Actor actor)
      Return a string of description on this action for display and for the Player to choose based on the direction.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FireShotgunAction

        public FireShotgunAction​(java.lang.String direction,
                         java.lang.String hotKey,
                         int damagePoints)
        Create a FireShotgunAction object using a String that specifies the direction where the shotgun is fired towards, a String that specifies the key used in the menu and an integer that specifies the damage points of the target.
        Parameters:
        direction - a String that specifies the direction where the shotgun is fired towards.
        hotKey - a String that specifies the key used in the menu.
        damagePoints - an integer that specifies the damage points of the target.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public java.lang.String execute​(Actor actor,
                                GameMap map)
        Allow the shotgun to hurt the target within its area of effect based on the direction chosen by the Player and return description of the firing action of the shotgun. When firing towards the cardinal directions (N,E,S,W), fireTowardsCardinalDirection(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap, int, int, int, int) is called, else, when firing towards the ordinal directions (NW, NE, SW, SE), fireTowardsOrdinalDirection(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap, int, int, int, int) is called, with arguments to set the range of the area of effect and to hurt the actors within the range. If the return value is empty, indicating that no actor is within the area of effect.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action.
        map - The map the actor is on.
        Returns:
        The string of description on the firing action of the shotgun.

      • menuDescription

        public java.lang.String menuDescription​(Actor actor)
        Return a string of description on this action for display and for the Player to choose based on the direction.
        Specified by:
        menuDescription in class Action
        Parameters:
        actor - The actor performing the action.
        Returns:
        The string of description on this action for display.

      • hotkey

        public java.lang.String hotkey()
        Returns the key used in the menu to trigger this Action.
        Overrides:
        hotkey in class Action
        Returns:
        The key we use for this Action in the menu, or null to have it assigned for you.
